title: Wine Decanter With Stopper, "Prism-cut", ca. 1835
provenance: These originals from ca. 1835-1850 were still without the copper wheel-engraved Habsburg crest; this was added as late as ca. 1885/90. The set, for roughly 400 persons, still rests in the "Silver Chamber" in the Vienna Imperial Court Building.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Mouth-blown crystal, facetted and relief-prismatic-cut and polished

participants.person_name: J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria

tombstone.epitaph:
Wine Decanter With Stopper, "Prism-cut", ca. 1835.
ca. 1835. Glass. Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 2009-18-3-a,b.
